header.abstract: The Walter T. Bradley, Jr. papers (dated 1914-2003, undated; 3.86 cubic feet; 8 boxes) comprise correspondence, newsletters, magazines, business papers, and photographs relating to the personal life and involvement in Freemasonry of Walter T. Bradley Jr.

descriptive_summary.author: Logan McGuire
descriptive_summary.title: Walter T. Bradley, Jr. papers
descriptive_summary.arrangement: Collection is arranged in four series by content and format: Photographs, Prince Hall Grand Lodge, Publications, and Personal papers.

descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2019ms041: [identification of item], Walter T. Bradley, Jr. papers, 1921-2003, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: A branch of North American Freemasonry, Prince Hall Freemasonry was founded in 1784 by its namesake after he and a group of fourteen other African-Americans were refused admittance into the St. John Lodge in Boston, Massachusetts. After this rejection Prince Hall and his group applied to the Grand Lodge of England and were granted a charter for African Lodge No. 459, which would go on to become the stepping block from which all of Prince Hall Freemasonry would eventually develop. More lodges were organized during the remainder of Prince Hall's life, and after his death a Grand Lodge was formed in his name. This Grand Lodge would later be denied acknowledgment by the Grand Lodge of Massachusetts and subsequently declare itself independent in 1827. Persisting as a predominantly African-American fraternity, Prince Hall Freemasonry stood as an opportunity for African-Americans to join a lodge despite widespread racial segregation in the country. Walter T. Bradley Jr. was a member of the Lodge, attaining a rank of 33rd degree mason and holding the position of Grand Secretary of the Most Worshipful Prince Hall Grand Lodge F. & A. M. of Kentucky. He took his duties seriously and devoted much of his professional and personal life to the betterment of the Lodge and its members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Walter T. Bradley, Jr. papers (dated 1914-2003, undated; 3.86 cubic feet; 8 boxes) comprise correspondence, newsletters, magazines, business papers, and photographs relating to his personal life and involvement in Freemasonry. The bulk of the collection relates to Walter's involvement in Freemasonry, whether as a standard member or as the Grand Secretary of the Prince Hall Grand Lodge of Kentucky. Included are documents concerning day-to-day matters of the Prince Hall Lodge of Kentucky as well as copies of The Masonic Herald and The Phylaxis; newsletters regularly distributed to members of the Masonic lodge. Also included are photographs of both individuals and groups of significance to Bradley and his Freemasonry in addition to documents regarding Bradley's life outside of the Lodge and its teachings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to these materials belong to the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of members of Bluegrass Consistory #46 both as individuals and in group shots, at their home lodge as well as at various conferences. These photos vary from candid shots to official portraits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents concerning the Prince Hall Grand Lodge and its members. It holds various official business papers such as articles of incorporation and amendment as well as correspondence and documents detailing membership benefits. Also included are annual communications from the Lodge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of publications concerning the Prince Hall Lodge and masonry in general. It includes various periodicals such as the Phylaxis and the Masonic Herald.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The personal papers series includes Walter T. Bradley, Jr.'s files ranging from personal correspondence to documents of duties and responsibilities as a deacon.
